lst.name: sentence
lst.str: U.S. Energy Secretary John Herrington said, "The Reagan Administration is firmly committed, without equivocation, to continuing our efforts to improve conditions and incentives in the marketplace that will spur oil and gas exploration and development."

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "Improved technology has the potential for reducing the capital investment and operating costs of typical heavy oil development projects by 30 pct or more," Gordon Willmon, VP and general manager, oil sands and coal department, Esso Resources Canada Ltd said at the World Petroleum Congress.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Willmon also said, "Public policy could best help by providing financial support to offset the high cost of technology developmemt which would help generate projects that could survive even at low oil prices for extended periods of time."
